ygData.subject: Re: Laptops & EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: The Dell 7000 and 7500 run EQ great. There are a couple off ppl here at my office who are running EQ on those notebooks. ... From: Bob Stewart To:
ygData.messageBody:
The Dell 7000 and 7500 run EQ great. There are a couple off ppl here at my office who are running EQ on those notebooks.
----- Original Message -----
From: Bob Stewart
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Sent: Monday, October 04, 1999 3:25 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Laptops & EQ


At 12:05 PM 04-10-99 -0600, Blair, Keith (Keith Blair) wrote:
>Has anyone ever gotten EQ to work on a laptop? I'm purchasing a laptop, but
>would like to find one that could run EQ as well so I could run my bard all
>around while I run around. If anyone has any recommendations or experiences,
>please share them.

I asked the same question a while back and couldn't find much solid
information. I've yet to find anyone who has experience with playing
EverQuest on a laptop.

As I type this I'm waiting for Dell to call me back so I can order an
Inspiron 7500. As far as I can tell it will run EverQuest pretty well. I
talked to 989 Systems support and was told the ATI Rage Mobility 3D
hardware in the Dell is sufficient for EverQuest even though they don't
list it as supported.

Ultimately I won't know until I try it. Dell has a 30-day satisfaction
guarantee, so if it doesn't work I'm not stuck.

I'll report back how fast Thrush runs on the Inspiron, probably in a couple
weeks.

Bob




------------------------------------------------------------------------------
